items.title: 8BitDo’s officially licensed Xbox all-button arcade controller hits one of its lowest prices today at 30% off
items.summary:
As part of its now live video game sale, Woot is offering the officially licensed Xbox variant of 8BitDo’s All-Button Arcade Controller for $69.99 Prime shipped (a $6 delivery fee will apply otherwise). This particular variant of the controller is compatible with Xbox Series X|S and Windows PCs, and it typically goes for $100 at Amazon, where it has never dropped below the $73 mark. Today’s deal delivers a 30% markdown, shaving $30 off its usual going rate. This is the lowest price we have tracked for this unit outside a limited promo code offer that had it for a touch lower, so be sure to snag it after getting more details below.

items.title: Anker extends SOLIX Winter Sale’s up to 65% power station savings – F3800 unit at $1,799 low, more from $150
items.summary:
Update 1/27: Anker has extended its Winter Sale (with some increased savings on select units) through to February 3 – giving you more time to take advantage of these deals. Prices have been updated below. We also recently dropped our hands-on review of the Anker SOLIX C2000 Gen 2 Power Station here.

Anker SOLIX is joining its competitors in bringing back previous holiday savings in the form of its latest Winter Sale that is offering up to 65% discounts and FREE gifts with select units. One unit I want to point out is Anker’s SOLIX F3800 Portable Power Station at $1,899 $1,799 shipped, which matches the price we’re seeing at Amazon, though be sure to clip the on-page 5% off coupon. It may have a $3,999 MSRP direct from the brand, but at Amazon you can find it starting between $2,399 and $2,599. It’s mostly been keeping above $2,000 since December, which is when we saw the $1,799 low from Black Friday and Cyber Monday sales rise in price. You’re looking at the next-best rate today that even beats out the previous New Year sale by $100, with $700 struck from the going rate ($2,100 off the MSRP), making this quite the surprise offer. Head below to check out the full lineup for Anker’s SOLIX Winter Sale while it lasts through the week.

more…

items.title: Germany sees beer sales sink to 30-year low as consumers cut spending
items.summary: FRANKFURT, Feb. 2 (Xinhua) -- Germany's beer sales fell to about 7.8 billion liters in 2025, down 6.0 percent compared with the previous year, as weak consumer sentiment weighed on demand, data released Monday by the country's Federal Statistical Office (Destatis) showed. Read full story

items.title: Notepad++ says Chinese government hackers hijacked its software updates for months
items.summary: The developer of the popular text editor Notepad++ said hackers associated with the Chinese government hijacked its software update mechanism to deliver tainted software to users for months.

items.title: Former Windows 8 boss recruited Epstein to help negotiate his messy Microsoft exit
items.summary: Emails between former Windows boss Steven Sinofsky and Jeffrey Epstein, published by the Justice department on Friday, appear to show that Sinofsky constantly sought Epstein's advice as he negotiated his surprise exit from Microsoft in November 2012, forwarding emails to him in nearly real time as talks progressed. Sinofsky also appears to have paid Epstein […]

items.title: EcoFlow’s Big Game Day sale drops DELTA 3 Max Plus + Trail 60,000mAh power station bundle to $1,033, more
items.summary:
EcoFlow has launched a Big Game Day Sale with up to 64% discounts on power stations and bundles leading up to the Super Bowl on Sunday, complete with free gifts, bonus savings, and more. One notable inclusion that we spotted was EcoFlow’s DELTA 3 Max Plus Portable Power Station getting a FREE Trail 200 DC 60,000mAh Power Station at $1,033.06 shipped,after using the code ECOAFF6 at checkout for an additional 6% savings. You notice the station sports a $1,899 full price, but you’re much more likely to find it cut down to $1,499 to $1,099 on average, like it currently is at Amazon (with the FREE Trail station offer). Previous discounts on the power station alone have gone lower to $1,049 and a one-time-only drop to $799 that lasted only a few hours on January 21, while this bundle has only been offered in flash sales for $1,099 and had an original launch deal of $1,044. You’re now looking at the second-best price we have tracked yet for these two stations together, with $466 slashed from the going rate ($866 off the MSRP). Head below to learn more and browse some of the other deals we spotted during this event.
